about.title: About
about.html:
Bicycle Route Planner is capable of computing routes for cyclists from an origin to a destination. It solves the bicycle route planning problem based on a formal model expressive enough to represent transport network features and cyclists' preferences grounded in the studies of real-world bicycle route choice behaviour. Our solution employs the A* algorithm together with vectors of cost and heuristic functions – able to optimise routes for travel time, comfort, quietness, and flatness.

Currently, the Bicycle Route Planner is developed by Pavol Žilecký, Jan Hrnèíø, Qing Song and Jan Linka under the supervision of Michal Jakob at Agent Technology Center, Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Czech Technical University in Prague. Initial version, Open Bicycle Trip Planner, has been designed and implemented as a bachelor thesis of Marcel Német under the supervision of Jan Hrnèíø and Michal Jakob in 2013.
